definition: to lower in grade, rank, or status : demote
to strip of rank or honors
to lower to an inferior or less effective level
to scale down in desirability or salability
to bring to low esteem or into disrepute
examples: his actions have degraded his profession
punishments intended to humiliate and degrade prisoners

definition: to drag down in moral or intellectual character : corrupt
examples: the Indians who consume peyote buttons do not seem to be … morally degraded by the habit

definition: to impair in respect to some physical property
examples: material degraded by exposure to sunlight

definition: to reduce the complexity of (a chemical compound) : decompose
to pass from a higher grade or class to a lower
examples: causes the meat to degrade in quality
